CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ( “ the ORG ” ) read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Preventive measures may be applied by the prosecuting authority or by the court only in those cases where there are serious grounds for believing that an accused ... will abscond , obstruct the establishment of the truth during the criminal proceedings or reoffend ; alternatively , they can be applied by the court in order to ensure the enforcement of a sentence .

CARDINAL . Detention pending trial and alternative preventive measures may be imposed only in cases concerning offences in respect of which the law provides for a custodial sentence exceeding DATE . In cases concerning offences in respect of which the law provides for a custodial sentence of DATE , they may be applied if ... the accused has already committed the acts mentioned in paragraph CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . NORP In deciding on the necessity of applying preventive measures , the prosecuting authority and the court shall take into consideration the following additional criteria :
( CARDINAL ) the nature and degree of harm caused by the offence ;
( CARDINAL ) the character of the ... accused ;
( CARDINAL ) his / her age and state of health ;
( CARDINAL ) his / her occupation ;
( CARDINAL ) his / her family status and the existence of any dependants ;
( CARDINAL ) his / her economic status ;
( CARDINAL ) the existence of a permanent place of abode ;
( CARDINAL) other essential circumstances ... ”

“ CARDINAL . Requests ... shall be examined and decided upon immediately after being lodged . If the authority to which the request is addressed can not decide upon it immediately , it shall give its decision within DATE from the date of receipt . ... ”

CARDINAL . Following the entry into force of the new Code of Criminal Procedure on DATE , the first - instance courts were obliged to ensure that a judge was on duty at DATE and on DATE to deal with any urgent matters . According to a certificate issued by the President of ORG , that court had put in place a duty roster of this kind .
CARDINAL . In its judgment in PERSON ( judgment of DATE , ICJ Reports DATE , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) ) , ORG decided that :

“ CARDINAL . As regards the question whether GPE has complied with the obligation incumbent upon it as a result of LAW , the ORG observes that the Order indicated CARDINAL provisional measures , the first of which states that

' [ GPE should take alCARDINAL measures at its disposal to ensure that PERSON is not executed pending the final decision in these proceedings , and should inform ORG the measures which it has taken in implementation of this Order ' .
The second measure required the Government of GPE to ' transmit this Order to the Governor of GPE . ... ORG had transmitted to the Governor of GPE a copy of ORG . ...

GPE authorities have thus limited themselves to the mere transmission of the text of the Order to the Governor of GPE . This certainly met the requirement of the second of the CARDINAL measures indicated . As to the first measure , the ORG notes that it did not create an obligation of result , but that GPE was asked to ' take alCARDINAL measures at its disposal to ensure that PERSON is not executed pending the final decision in these proceedings ' . The ORG agrees that due to the extremely late presentation of the request for provisional measures , there was certainly very little time for GPE authorities to act .

CARDINAL . The ORG observes , nevertheless , that the mere transmission of its Order to the Governor of GPE without any comment , particularly without even so much as a plea for a temporary stay and an explanation that there is no general agreement on the position of GPE that orders of ORG on provisional measures are non - binding , was certainly less than could have been done even in the short time available . ...
CARDINAL . It is also noteworthy that the Governor of GPE , to whom ORG had been transmitted , decided not to give effect to it , even though ORG had recommended a stay of execution for PERSON .

CARDINAL . Finally , ORG rejected a separate application by GPE for a stay of execution , ' [ g]iven the tardiness of the pleas and the jurisdictional barriers they implicate ' . Yet it would have been open to ORG , as one of its members urged , to grant a preliminary stay , which would have given it ' time to consider , after briefing from alCARDINAL interested parties , the jurisdictional and international legal issues involved . . . ' ( GPE et al . v. GPE et al . , ORG , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . The review of the above steps taken by the authorities of GPE with regard to LAW DATE indicates that the various competent GPE authorities failed to take DATE the steps they could have taken to give effect to ORG . The Order did not require GPE to exercise powers it did not have : but it did impose the obligation to ' take alCARDINAL measures at its disposal to ensure that PERSON is not executed pending the final decision in these proceedings ... ' . The ORG finds that GPE did not discharge this obligation .
Under these circumstances the ORG concludes that GPE has not complied with LAW . ”
